Paper 1.stem: The first four diagrams in a sequence are shown below. Diagram 1 has 4 grey squares. Diagram 2 has 8 grey squares. Diagram 3 has 12 grey squares.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Three square grids showing a pattern of grey and white squares. Diagram 1 is a 3x3 grid with corners grey. Diagram 2 is a 4x4 grid. Diagram 3 is a 5x5 grid.

parts.questionText: Find the number of grey squares in Diagram 5.
Find an expression, in terms of n, for the number of grey squares in Diagram n.
Diagram n has 400 white squares. Find n.

Paper 1.title: Number Patterns in Grids

Paper 2.diagramDescription: Also contains a cone diagram for part b.

parts.questionText: Given that $C\subset A$, $n(C)=3$ and $B\cap C=\emptyset$, list the elements of a possible set C.
The diagram shows a cone P of height 24 cm. The volume of the liquid in the cone is half the volume of the cone. Calculate the depth, d cm, of the liquid.
The volume of cone P is v $cm^{3}$. Cone T has radius which is double that of the cone P and its height is one-third that of the cone P. Express the volume of cone T in terms of v.
A, B and C are points on the circumference of a circle. Angle $CAB=$ angle CBA. DA and DB are tangents to the circle from the point D. Prove that triangle ACD and triangle BCD are congruent.

Paper 2.title: Sets and Cone Volume
